instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
hello,
The <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> had exploded. I change it. The <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> had exploded. I change it.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> : 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> :0.463 diode mode

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>' 17/18 3.3 ohm  27/28: 21 ohm

pin 1: Voltaj yok
pin 2: 16.26 Volt
pin 3: 3.9 Volt
pin 9: 0,3 Volt
pin 12: 3,4 Volt
pin 13: 3,3 Volt
pin 14: 3,4 Volt
pin 15: 0,074 Volt
pin 17: 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed
pin 19: 5 Volt
pin 20: 5 Volt
pin 23: 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed
pin 26: 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed
pin 27: 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
"pin 1: Voltaj yok"
Is the second time when I see this mention; I still don't understand what means.
Please, post useful information.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> may be bad, but need to know pin 1/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltage, to make an idea.

BTW, <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> seems to be good.
"<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> : 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> :0.463 diode mode"
Do you mean <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> instead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
I'm so confused, I'm in a hurry and I'm typing wrong. :) 

Voltaj yok = No Voltage :) 
maybe you can learn some Turkish :)

Pin1 : No Voltage

Do you mean <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> instead? Yes

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  : 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> :0.463 diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Remove F7040/41 and check <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> voltage.

Check the 4 <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>'s resistors.
If all good, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Remove F7040/41 and check <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> voltage.
<CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> : 1 Volt

i changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Do you get now voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
You've said not before:
"pin 27: 1,7 -1.9 Volt no fixed"
